seasonal: July is generally a positive month for gold. Seasonally bullish.

insights: Gold hit all-time highs on April 21 and is currently in a correction/consolidation phase within the larger uptrend
Elliott Wave analysis using 'wave counting' theory shows the uptrend from October 2022 consists of 5 main waves with sub-waves
According to Elliott Wave theory, the uptrend contains 3 impulse waves (1, 3, 5) and 2 corrective waves (2, 4); wave 3 is typically the strongest, and gold's wave 3 has clearly been the dominant one
Wave 5 (current) is expected to complete the uptrend before a meaningful correction begins downward
Currently appears to be at wave 5 based on the current spiral count, meaning the wave completing the uptrend - before a correction that could be significant

In a pattern shift framework with N-pattern reversal on the weekly chart, the longer the correction continues before the next upward move, the deeper it may be - potentially the deepest seen in gold in the last 2.5 years
If the ABCD Fibonacci extension pattern is used: movement AB to CD with Fibonacci extensions - point D arrived around the area where we got resistance from the chart at approximately $3,516
Gold dropped in May to Fibonacci 38.2% ($3,134) and immediately bounced back up
The Fibonacci extension target if gold breaks upward would be at $3,782
July key turning dates: July 4 and July 11 carry two weekly cycles from weeks ending at 4th and 11th respectively, so the actual cycle turning dates fall within the weeks starting with those dates
For N-pattern reversal (if confirmed), that would be a signal to open short opportunities but only on clear breakdown

support.description: Fibonacci 38.2% retracement level; gold bounced strongly from here in May
Major support zone; significant if broken would signal deeper correction
Fibonacci support level; beginning of the recent rally

resistance.description: Resistance from chart around this level where previous April resistance was encountered
ABCD pattern point D area; key chart resistance from April
Fibonacci extension upside target if gold breaks above resistance

technical.indicators: Weekly chart shows Elliott Wave structure with 5 main waves since October 2022 uptrend. Currently in wave 5 which is expected to complete the move before a significant correction. Wave 3 was dominant and the longest. Elliott theory suggests wave 5 typically ends the impulsive move. ABCD Fibonacci extension pattern shows point D arrival at chart resistance approximately $3,516. Gold bounced from the 38.2% Fibonacci retracement at $3,134 in May. Daily chart shows consolidation near highs with daily support around $2,960 and the 50-day MA. Gold is positioned at all-time highs with technical indicators suggesting the current bullish wave is in its final stages.

summary: Gold remains in a long-term uptrend but is approaching the completion of wave 5 in its Elliott Wave structure, suggesting a meaningful correction could be ahead. Seasonally, July is positive for gold. Key turning dates cluster around July 10-11 and July 21-22, with high-probability statistics pointing to up moves around July 8 and July 17, and down moves around July 15 and July 22 (76% probability). The Fibonacci structure provides clear support at $3,134 and resistance at $3,516, with an upside target of $3,782 if a breakout occurs.
previous_month_review: In June 2025, there were four turning point dates for gold that worked well in a 'clean' classical fashion. The first date (June 6) arrived one day early and served as the high of the move, from which a downward move began. The second date (June 11-12) was a double cycle: the first date marked the low and from there gold climbed toward resistance at $3,436, providing a move of about 3.5% to the high, though it changed direction before the next date. The third date (June 20) arrived one day early in a downward move, appeared to mark the turning point but stopped for one day and then broke downward. The fourth date (June 25-26) was a double cycle: the price stopped at the first date and climbed slightly into resistance (retest), from where the direction continued downward as had already been happening since the second date.
risk_notes: Wave 5 completion in Elliott Wave theory typically precedes meaningful corrections - could be the deepest gold correction in 2.5 years
If N-pattern reversal on the weekly chart materializes, expect a significant downward move
Break below $3,080 support would signal a deeper correction is underway
The correction from the all-time high could be sharp since it would represent an N-pattern reversal in the resistance and pattern shift framework
Trading against the prevailing uptrend requires confirmation from both turning date and chart pattern
